Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Sincerely \Sin*cere"ly\, adv. In a sincere manner. Specifically: (a) Purely; without alloy. --Milton. (b) Honestly; unfeignedly; without dissimulation; as, to speak one's mind sincerely; to love virtue sincerely. [1913 Webster]

sincerely adv 1: with sincerity; without pretense; "she praised him sincerely for his victory"; "was unfeignedly glad to see his old teacher"; "we are truly sorry for the inconvenience" [syn: {unfeignedly}, {truly}] [ant: {insincerely}] 2: written formula for ending a letter [syn: {sincerely yours}]
